column3:
Concept ACK

> If the consensus is that using LIEF is ok, then I also plan on replacing pixie.py

SGTM the only reason i created pixie is to avoid having to install an external python library like this, but if that is what we are going to do, it is better to use it for everything. I think the only reason to prefer the current approach is to have close control over the checks, but there are

> I do wonder if we should fix a specific version instead of 'install the latest from PIP' which sounds suboptimal for security-critical things.\n\nI might be misunderstanding, but at the moment we've pinned the installation to version `0.11.4`. We could also enhance this by [checking hashes during installation](https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/reference/pip_install/?highlight=--hash#hash-checking-

Contributing GUIX hashes, mine match fanquake:

find guix-build-$(git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD)/output/ -type f -print0 | env LC_ALL=C sort -z | xargs -r0 sha256sum

Would be even better.
